summary: “And when your tears have drowned you, the valonqar shall wrap his hands about your pale white throat and choke the life from...
body:
“And when your tears have drowned you, the valonqar shall wrap his hands about your pale white throat and choke the life from you”

Ok so I’m interested to know what is everyone’s personal theory/preference for the character/s that will fulfil this prophecy? My crack guess is Bran, whilst pulling a hodor with the mountain, but I know it’s crack. Arya was my long term guess but now I’m not sure, and I’ve never been sold on Jaime. Would love to hear other candidates too, who people think it could be and their reasoning!

summary: As far as Gendry and Arya...
body:
As far as Gendry and Arya…

As excited as I am for that reunion, is it wrong that I also kinda want Arya to basically tell him to fuck right off at first?

Because like, bro, she wanted you to stay with her. She wanted you to be part of her pack, her family. And you kinda told her no, not good enough. So yeah, I can’t wait for them to meet again but I also want Arya to be like

summary: Lizo’s TV lookahead 2019
title: Lizo’s TV lookahead 2019
body:
2019 is shaping up to be one of the most significant years yet for TV.

Apple are set to launch their new streaming service, having already signed a deal with Oprah Winfrey. It will also broadcast projects from La La Land director Damien Chazelle and Reese Witherspoon.

Meanwhile, Disney is launching its rival to Netflix and Amazon – among the offerings from Disney Plus will be new stories from the Marvel and Star Wars universes.

Launch dates and details for many of the new series still aren’t public. But there’s also plenty to look forward to from the traditional broadcasters and other streamers.

Here are a few shows to watch out for:

Game of Thrones series 8 (Sky Atlantic)

“When you play the Game of Thrones, you win or you die,” predicted Lena Headey’s Cersei Lannister during the show’s first season. She wasn’t exaggerating. Several series later, the show is metaphorically littered with the bodies of characters who have fallen along the way. Now millions of fans are desperate to discover who will finally sit on the Iron Throne, and rule the fantasy land of Westeros. The journey there promises to be an epic one.

Line of Duty Series 5 (BBC One)

Skip Instagram post by mrmartincompston
View this post on Instagram

When you’ve been travelling/partying for 5 days then it’s Monday and yer back at work. On the case with AC12 again #LOD5

A post shared by Martin Compston (@mrmartincompston) on Oct 29, 2018 at 4:33am PDT

Report

End of Instagram post by mrmartincompston

The nerve-shredding, Bafta-winning police corruption drama was already one of TV’s biggest hits before its creator Jed Mercurio delivered 2018’s most-watched drama Bodyguard. Now even more viewers are likely to be drawn to his other huge BBC success, Line of Duty, which follows the investigators of AC-12, the police anti-corruption unit which polices the police. Sure to be filled with plot twist upon plot twist, joining as a guest star this year is Stephen Graham.

His Dark Materials (BBC One/HBO)

Novelist Philip Pullman’s fantasy, set in the world we know and many other parallel universes, has already had the big screen treatment with the first book filmed as The Golden Compass. This TV adaptation, set out over a far longer timeframe, promises to give the story the space it needs to fully pay justice to the complex and compelling narrative, as a young girl called Lyra sets out on a journey that starts in an Oxford college and which has implications for an entire universe.

Years and Years (BBC One)

The latest drama from Russell T Davies of Doctor Who, Queer as Folk and A Very English Scandal fame follows the Lyons, a family living in Manchester. The cast includes Emma Thompson as a celebrity turned politician in the story which begins on a fateful night in 2019 and then follows what happens to them over the next 15 years.

The Big Bang Theory (Channel 4)

The comedy, which initially followed a pair of scientists and their actress neighbour, has grown into a global hit with its cast reportedly commanding million dollar per episode salaries. Its final episode is due to air later this year. But Big Bang fans need not despair. Its spin-off, Young Sheldon, while not as wildly successful as Big Bang, is expected to continue for a good few seasons yet.

The Crown series 3 (Netflix)

The third series of Netflix’s drama picks up the story of the royal family in the mid 1960s. Olivia Colman and Helena Bonham Carter take over from Claire Foy and Vanessa Kirby as Queen Elizabeth and Princess Margaret. While the years covered are perhaps less tumultuous than the Monarch’s earlier years, the quality of writing and some of Britain’s best acting talent are likely to ensure the series continues to attract viewers and awards.

Victoria (ITV)

ITV’s historical drama, which stars Jenna Coleman as Queen Victoria and Tom Hughes as Prince Albert, is now in its third series, and remains popular with viewers here and in the US. Among the themes being explored in this run of episodes is developing tension in the marriage of the royal couple.

Brooklyn Nine-Nine

Fans were devastated when the cop comedy was cancelled by Fox in 2018 after five seasons. So they were of course delighted when, shortly after, the show was revived by NBC. And its sixth season will kick off in the US later this month. Its opening episode will reveal the resolution of the season five cliffhanger. However, show regular Chelsea Peretti, who plays Gina Linetti, has said she’ll only appear in a handful of episodes this season.

Love Island (ITV 2)

The phenomenally successful show where singletons look for love at a sun-kissed villa, is for many, TV’s most talked about programme. It’s already spawned a number of international spin-offs, and such is its success and popularity, tens of thousands are now applying for each new series.

Follow us on Facebook, on Twitter @BBCNewsEnts, or on Instagram at bbcnewsents. If you have a story suggestion email entertainment.news@bbc.co.uk.

Related Topics

  • Love Island
  • Game of Thrones
  • Television

Read more: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-46622643

The post Lizo’s TV lookahead 2019 appeared first on Viral TV News.

summary: [SPOILERS] The name Winterfell
title: [SPOILERS] The name Winterfell
body:
Haven’t been on this sub since season 7 ended.

Out of all the complex theories, I’m not sure if I missed this one, but doesn’t the name say it all? Is TAOTD going to “fall” in the land of the starks, bringing winter to an end, thus, winterfell ? I can’t be the only person to ever think of this



Source: http://bit.ly/2SrTamW

summary: [SPOILERS] My Season 8 elaborate predictions
title: [SPOILERS] My Season 8 elaborate predictions
body:
Based solely on my imagination and having way too much time on my hands - roll on April :)

Episode 1: Winterfell reunions while the Northernmost castles fall. Castle Black is destroyed, and the remaining Night’s Watch are slaughtered and become Wights. Tormund and Dundarion managed to survive Eastwatch and begin to make their way South. When Jon, Dany and co arrive at Winterfell, Jon plays diplomat between the Stark sisters and Dany, including telling them he has given her his allegiance… Sansa does not like this. Arya has a reunion with Gendry. Bran / Sam ask to speak with Jon in private - but before they can tell him of his lineage, a raven arrives with news that the wall has been breached and the Night King is heading their way. Soon Jaime arrives. Bran sees Jaime and remembers what happened in the pilot. Jaime’s help is welcomed by Jon and Tyrion but not welcomed by the other Starks. Bran advises them to let Jaime live. In the end they reluctantly do so. Night King’s army closes in on Winterfell to end the episode.

Episode 2: Battle for Winterfell. Dany is horrified to see what has become of one of her dragons. Ghost saves Jon but is killed in the process. Jaime saves Bran’s life towards the end of the battle. Winterfell is completely overrun and the protagonists are forced to flee. Dany and her dragons buy them time enabling them to flee but Dany is wounded. They get away, but they are scattered / separated a little. Anyone killed gets turned into a Wight, including ghost.

Episode 3 Winterfell survivors regroup - Jaime promises to lead them south to the safety of Kings landing and Red Keep. Jon agrees. Tarly tells Jon his lineage. He is shocked. Ravens work overtime to warn the land of impending doom and for everyone to retreat to Kings Landing. The Unsullied receive one of these ravens and leave Casterly Rock to march for Kings Landing. Euron’s plans to get the Golden Company backfire when Daario Naharis thwarts him in Essos. Euron is forced to flee without them. Bran tells Jaime he knows Cersei is planning to double cross the North. Jaime promises everyone that he and Tyrion will be able to convince Cersei to let them into the city when they arrive at King’s Landing. Dany’s condition worsens. She becomes ill, and it is learned she is pregnant. They arrive at King’s landing, and Cersei locks the gates, leaving them out in the cold of Winter while she outlasts the Winter from within the city with Olenna’s grain. She and Qyburn planted Wildfire all around the city walls and vows to blow up anyone that tries to get in, including Jaime and Tyrion. She will only let them in on one condition, that they kill Dany and swear loyalty to her. Bronn delivers this message on behalf of Cersei, but then he too is locked out when Jon refuses to sacrifice Dany.

Episode 4: Battle at sea between Euron and Theon, Yara is saved but she dies anyway, proclaiming Theon to be redeemed before dying. Theon receives word of Westeros’ plight and sails for Blackwater Bay with supplies. The Unsullied arrive at King’s Landing. They camp with the others outside the walls for months, everyone outside the wall begins to starve. As the months pass, news arrives of the destruction of other northern castles and cities such as Oldtown, The Eyrie, etc, and the progress south of the Night King’s army. Dany’s pregnancy progresses, but her condition weakens. Pressure grows on Jon and co to sacrifice her, but he stands firm. Theon arrives with supplies which are most welcome. Melisandre is with him, much to the anger of Davos. A plan is hatched by Varys & Tyrion to fly a dragon over the walls, and open the gates from the inside. They convince Jon that only he will have a chance to control Dany’s dragons now, given Dany is unwell and Jon has Targaryan blood. “Night Ghost” attacks Jon’s tent - Jon kills him, and now knows the rest of the Night King’s army will soon be upon them. Cersei looks out her window to see Jon flying over the city walls on a Dragon.

Episode 5: Battle of the Living in Kings Landing. Some big deaths. Jon does enough to get the gates open but his dragon is shot down and both Jon and the dragon die. The remaining protagonists storm the city and defeat Cersei’s forces. Cersei should be heavily pregnant by now but it becomes clear she was faking it. She is taken prisoner, placed in the same cell alongside Ellaria Sand and the rotted corpse of her daughter. Arya wants to kill her but she demands a trial by combat. Tyrion convinces everyone to grant this. She picks the Mountain to represent her in a trial by combat. The protagonists fortify their position in King’s landing, along with the Unsullied. Dany goes into premature labour, and starts to see Khal Drogo in hallucinations. The Hound kills the Mountain in Cersei’s trial by combat by burning him. Cersei is sentenced to death but The Night King attacks before the execution can be carried out.

Episode 6: Remaining Protagonists in the final Battle with Night King and Army of Dead. The Wildfire Cersei had planted is useful in the battle. Dundarion dies in efforts to light this fire with his flaming sword. Melisandre and Varys die also in this battle, but Melisandre… in her last breath… notices Jaime Lannister’s golden hand, and tells him he is the Lord of Light just before she dies. Jaime Lannister armed with valyrian steel, flies atop the one remaining living dragon, which Bran has warged into… and this unlikely partnership kills the Night King in an aerial battle. Jaime dies a hero in Brienne’s arms. Now his pages can be filled. Bran also dies because of volatile warging. Dany gives birth to a healthy boy, but shortly afterwards succumbs to her weakened condition and dies in Jorah’s arms. Arya takes Jaime’s face and Cersei finally is killed just as she thinks Jaime is releasing her from her cell. Ellaria is freed. All dragons die. Arya’s list is complete. Jorah is redeemed / forgiven by Lyanna Mormont. A new era dawns, under the rule of the newborn Targaryen boy. Tyrion is to be steward of the throne until he comes of age, and he forms a council with Davos, Jorah and Missandei. Grey Worm becomes head of the Kingsguard. In the North, there must always be a Stark in Winterfell - Sansa. Brienne and Tormund escort her north again as her appointed stewards and hint at getting together. Arya sails East to find a new life. Gendry goes with her, as does the Hound. Bronn gets a castle. Theon returns to the Iron Islands. Sam becomes archmaester, and needs to start new records because Oldtown was recently destroyed. He finishes the first book of the recent history, which he names “A Song of Ice and Fire”.



Source: http://bit.ly/2s2ICiz

summary: Recap: Daenerys killing Lord Tarly and his son was the right choice
title: Recap: Daenerys killing Lord Tarly and his son was the right choice
body:
1) She gave Randyll and Dickon a choice. Submit or die. They made their choices.
2) Randyll Tarly betrayed House Tyrell. It was the same crime that the Boltons did to the Starks. 
3) By killing Lord Tarly and his son, she was able to make 50-100 men of the Lannister’s soldiers submit easily. 
4) Randyll was also a shitty father to Samwell Tarly. 

P.S. The Dothraki, the Wildlings and the ironborn have looted and raped before but Daenerys haters condemn her army alone. wtf.

summary: [SPOILERS] Arya & her dagger.
title: [SPOILERS] Arya & her dagger.
body:
I think she in the running along with Jon & Sam & Brienne will all kill a white walker with the Valyrian steel they’ve been given (or stole on Sam’s part) and Jon may somehow kill the knight king with his. Idk just a thought.



Source: http://bit.ly/2SvR19Z

summary: It's 2019 and I hope this is the year people stop shipping Sansa Stark with abusive older men
